content: and then seamed with an easy whip stitch at the end this allows you to decide the perfect circumference you want and you can decide as you go # this scarf starts with an unconventional starting sequence rather than a long chain or a foundation row i call each segment of the starting sequence a starter stitch the sequence is something i devised that is easier and it matches the stitch pattern so there is no odd row of single or double_crochet stitches that do not match the stitch pattern of the scarf # the stitch pattern makes a wavy pattern on the outer edges on the scarf so no further edging is necessary # i recommend stopping at an endpoint of 30 inches for a cowl and 60 or more inches for an infinity scarf or whatever is perfect for you you do not have to count row just stop when you get to your end point by crocheting the scarf flat you can try it on for fit to determine your perfect endpoint start crocheting you will crochet the starting sequence and then row 1-3 then you will repeat row 3 until you reach your endpoint you will be working stitches in the chain 3 spaces along the starting sequence no stitches are placed in the side ways double_crochet stitches of the starting sequence the stitch pattern is an easy one-row repeat i recommend a quick spritz wet block to even out the width of the cowl or infinity scarf before you do the final easy whip stitch seam one starter stitch copyright cj brady designs 2019 r o w 3 r o w 2 r o w 1 starting sequence starting sequence ends here starts here with a chain 3 starting sequence for a cowl or an infinity scarf using dk or light worsted weight yarn make a starting sequence of 12 starter stitches needs to be an even number if you want to alter the width of the scarf and/or use a different weight yarn chain 3 double_crochet in the third chain from the hook turn *chain 3 double_crochet in the same st as the chain 3 turn* repeat * * until you have 12 starter stitches one starter stitch is a chain 3 and a double_crochet paired together row 1 after the turn at the end of the starting sequence chain 3 and double_crochet in the same st as the chain 3 as if making another starter stitch and single_crochet in the first chain 3 space to the left *chain 3 double_crochet chain 1 double_crochet in the same chain 3 space skip over the next side ways double_crochet and single_crochet in the next chain 3 space* repeat * * across the row and after the last single_crochet in the last chain 3 space chain 3 double_crochet chain 1 double_crochet in the same chain 3 space and single_crochet in the very last chain of starting sequence was first chain when beginning the starting sequence turn pattern
